examples: A rubber duck and other toys were afloat in the bath.

definitions.definition: In, or found while in, a vessel at sea or on another body of water .
Floating in the air ; flowing freely; not tied, braided , etc. ( of hair or clothing )
Covered with water, bearing floating objects.
Covered , overspread , filled ( with or in something).
Having just enough resources to continue to operate ; barely able to pay expenses ; ( of a private individual, family, etc. ) keeping one's head above water .
examples: The donation will keep our business afloat for quite a while.

definitions.definition: Believed or talked about by many people; being passed from person to person.
examples: The supervisor was never fired, though countless accusations of dishonesty were afloat .

definitions.label_groups: obsolete , figurative , of an emotional state

definitions.definition: In a state of confusion , bewilderment , or distraction .

secondary_definitions: In, or found while in, a vessel at sea or on another body of water .
Floating in the air ; flowing freely; not tied, braided , etc. ( of hair or clothing )
Covered with water, bearing floating objects.
( figurative ) Covered , overspread , filled ( with or in something).
( of an organization ) Having just enough resources to continue to operate ; barely able to pay expenses ; ( of a private individual, family, etc. ) keeping one's head above water .
( figurative , of ideas, information, etc. ) Believed or talked about by many people; being passed from person to person.
( obsolete , figurative , of an emotional state ) Stimulated , aroused , activated .
( obsolete , figurative ) In a state of confusion , bewilderment , or distraction .
